issues.description: The problem statement's UML and the solution expect a Stock method named addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) (used to add a new StockIngredient), but the template Stock class provides a method named addItem(StockIngredient) instead. This name/signature mismatch is structural: students following the UML or the example code in the statement will attempt to call addToStockIngredients and will not find it in the provided template. Conversely, if they use addItem, their code will deviate from the intended API shown in the UML and the reference solution. This can confuse students implementing SealSaloon.acceptSupplyDelivery (which per the spec should add a new StockIngredient to the Stock) and may lead to failing tests or unnecessary friction.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template Stock API match the UML and the reference solution. Either rename the template method addItem(StockIngredient) to addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient), or add a small wrapper method addToStockIngredients that delegates to addItem. This ensures students can implement SealSaloon according to the specification without being blocked by a mismatched method name.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and the solution implementation expect a Stock method named addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient), but the template repository's Stock class provides a method named addItem(StockIngredient) instead. This naming mismatch can confuse students: the spec and solution use addToStockIngredients, so students following the problem text or the solution will look for that method but the starter code exposes addItem, leading to compilation errors or extra work to reconcile names.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across artifacts. Rename the template's Stock.addItem(StockIngredient) to addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) (or vice versa: update problem statement and solution to refer to addItem) so that the problem text, starter code, and solution use the same identifier. Prefer changing the template to addToStockIngredients to match the UML/spec and the provided solution.
